abstract: Boeing and Airbus are leaving the Farnborough International Airshow in Britain with around $54 billion in deals — just over half what they drew last year.
snippet: Boeing and Airbus are leaving the Farnborough International Airshow in Britain with around $54 billion in deals — just over half what they drew last year.
lead_paragraph: FARNBOROUGH, England — Boeing and Airbus announced a final wave of orders at a large aerospace trade show here on Thursday. But the world’s two biggest aircraft manufacturers are heading home with about $54 billion in deals — just more than half of what they drew last year.

headline.main: At Air Show, Orders Fall For Aircraft Companies
headline.print_headline: At Air Show, Orders Fall For Aircraft Companies
